title: Get Started
text: begin analyzing aart dataset. dataset represents scenario involving left-truncation. contains two columns: Xi (time--event) Yi (truncation time). estimate hazard rate using estimate_hazard(). Note , set carry_hazard = TRUE. argument ensures hazard estimate 0, replaced last non-zero estimate. function returns data.frame containing evaluation times, hazard estimates, standard errors (log scale). also includes lower upper bounds confidence interval corresponding ci_level argument (case, set 0.95). believe don’t need output fh uh columns. think?

title: Get Started
text: concise overview estimation, use summary() method: visualize hazard rate, can use base R graphics via plot() method:  Alternatively, use ggauto() ggplot2-powered visualization. function particularly useful visualizing multiple confidence levels simultaneously:

title: Get Started
text: package can also derive Cumulative Distribution Function (CDF) directly hazard estimates using calc_cdf(). appends cdf column results. can also plot CDF:

title: Get Started
text: workflow right-censored data nearly identical. demonstrate using mbalt dataset, includes third column, Di, serving right-censoring indicator. call estimate_hazard() , time provide censoring argument. argument accepts vector 1 indicates censored observation 0 indicates observed event. output structure remains consistent previous example. plotting functions also work box:  , ggplot2:
code: data(mbalt) head(mbalt) #>   Zi Yi Di #> 1 37 29  1 #> 2 30 29  1 #> 3 37 30  1 #> 4 32 32  1 #> 5 37 32  1 #> 6 36 33  1 mbalt_hazard <- estimate_hazard(lifetime = mbalt$Zi,                                 trunc_time = mbalt$Yi,                                 censoring = mbalt$Di,                                 ci_level = 0.95,                                 carry_hazard = FALSE) ## need summary(mbalt_hazard) #>    lifetime     hazard se_log_hazard   lower_ci  upper_ci #> 1         5 0.00000000    0.00000000         NA        NA #> 6        10 0.00000000    0.00000000         NA        NA #> 11       15 0.00000000    0.00000000         NA        NA #> 16       20 0.00000000    0.00000000         NA        NA #> 21       25 0.00000000    0.00000000         NA        NA #> 26       30 0.00000000    0.00000000         NA        NA #> 31       35 0.05596574    0.02623112 0.05316113 0.0589183 plot(mbalt_hazard) ggauto(mbalt_hazard, ci_level = c(.5, .75, .85, .9, .95)) #> Warning: Removed 135 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_ribbon()`).

title: Get Started
text: Finally, abslife can estimate hazards presence competing risks. use aloans dataset, contains data consumer automobile loans (Jackson P. Lautier, Pozdnyakov, Yan 2024). relevant columns dataset example following: Z: time event Y: left-truncation C: right censoring indicator D: Default indicator (1 represents default, 0 represents pre-payment) two competing risks case default pre-payment. make results interpretable, create descriptive event_type column. package designed workflow identical previous two examples. change passing column discriminating event types event_type argument estimate_hazard(). output now includes column specifying event type hazard estimate. plotting functions work previous examples, handling stratification event type automatically:  holds ggplot2 powered plots:

title: Calculate Default Time Points — calc_tp
text: helper function generates default sequence evaluation points based study's overall time range (Lautier et al. 2023, <DOI: 10.1016/j.ecosta.2023.05.005>). particular, calculates \(\Delta\) \(m\) based left-truncation time--event variables outputs sequence ranging \(\Delta + 1\) \(\omega\).

title: Calculate Default Time Points — calc_tp
text: lifetime vector event censoring times. trunc_time vector left-truncation times.

title: Calculate Default Time Points — calc_tp
text: numeric vector default time points evaluate hazard .

title: Auxiliary function for estimate_hazard — .hazard_core
text: Auxiliary function estimate_hazard

title: Auxiliary function for estimate_hazard — .hazard_core
code: .hazard_core(   support,   trunc_time,   lifetime,   censoring_indicator,   event_indicator,   carry_hazard )

title: Auxiliary function for estimate_hazard — .hazard_core
text: support calculate hazards trunc_time numeric vector representing observed left-truncated time. lifetime numeric vector representing observed time event. censoring_indicator indicator censoring (1=censored, 0=). Defaults vector 0s NULL. observation treated event status=1 censoring=0. event_indicator legacy. carry_hazard boolean indicator whether 0 hazard estimates replaced last non-zero estimate. Defaults FALSE

title: Auxiliary function for estimate_hazard — .hazard_core
text: data.frame

title: Auxiliary function for estimate_hazard — .hazard_core
text: lcgodoy

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: Estimate non-parametric hazard rate truncated censored data

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
code: estimate_hazard(   lifetime,   trunc_time = NULL,   censoring_indicator = NULL,   event_type = NULL,   support_lifetime_rv = NULL,   carry_hazard = FALSE,   ci_level = 0.95 )

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: lifetime numeric vector representing observed time event. trunc_time numeric vector representing observed left-truncated time. censoring_indicator indicator censoring (1=censored, 0=). Defaults vector 0s NULL. observation treated event status=1 censoring=0. event_type vector "events identifies" (experimental) support_lifetime_rv vector time points evaluate hazard.  NULL (default), calculated sequence Delta + 1 omega (, max(lifetime)). carry_hazard boolean indicator whether 0 hazard estimates replaced last non-zero estimate. Defaults FALSE ci_level number 0 1 indicating level confidence intervals.

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: data.frame hazard estimate standard errors asymptotic confidence intervals.

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: Point estimate asymptotic confidence intervals calculated based  (can also include brief notation/definitions )

title: \(\hat{f}(x)\) — f_hat
text: t time point hazard estimates sought. lifetime numeric vector representing observed time event. event event indicator censoring_indicator indicator censoring (1=censored, 0=). Defaults vector 0s NULL. observation treated event status=1 censoring=0.

title: Create an acdf Object — new_acdf
code: # Create a minimal data frame with the required columns df <- data.frame(lifetime = 1:2, risk_set = c(.8, .20),                  hazard = c(0.1, 0.125), se_log_hazard = c(0.1, 0.1),                  lower_ci = c(0.08, 0.1), upper_ci = c(0.12, 0.15))  # Construct the alife object my_alife_obj <- new_alife(df) class(my_alife_obj) #> [1] "alife"      "data.frame"

code: # Create a minimal data frame with the required columns df <- data.frame(lifetime = 1:2, risk_set = c(.8, .20),                  hazard = c(0.1, 0.125), se_log_hazard = c(0.1, 0.1),                  lower_ci = c(0.08, 0.1), upper_ci = c(0.12, 0.15))  # Construct the alife object my_alife_obj <- new_alife(df) class(my_alife_obj) #> [1] "alife"      "data.frame"

title: abslife 0.0.95
text: Now ci_level parameter allows plotting multiple confidence intervals changed default colors plotting. calc_cdf function also esimates density (addition CDF) output modified data.frame lifetime respective density CDF evaluations. summary plot methods output calc_cdf function. \(\hat{f}\) longer part output \(\hat{u}\) now referred risk_set ralife_cdf function sample “time event” data included package.

title: abslife 0.0.94
text: time_to_event becomes lifetime Logo included package website README file. First draft vignette. Two new datasets: aart (left-truncation) mbalt (left-truncation + right-censoring). event_indicator longer argument estimate_hazard().

title: abslife 0.0.93
text: ggplot2 included suggested package fixed “check” number events estimate_hazard broken smaller functions make easier mantain. Included summary function alife objects Extended plot function deal multiple event types rlang becomes dependency :( autoplot method making graphs ggplot2

title: abslife 0.0.92
text: Fixed competing risks approach.

title: abslife 0.0.91
text: event_type parameter estimate_hazard function now deals competing risks. single_t_hazard internal function created. meant make code easier debug expliting big estimate_hazard function self-contained chunks. ci_level now parameter estimate_hazard function. First draft estimate_hazard function. far, competing risks implemented. calc_tp helper calculates \(\Delta\) \(m\) based left-truncation time--event variables outputs sequence ranging \(\Delta + 1\) \(\Delta + m\). Create class alife enable plot method estimate_hazard function output. Function carry hazard estimates forward “zero hazard” observed.

title: abslife 0.0.9
text: dataset aloans included far.
